Item.Line: Welcome to the world of Ensembler!
You will embark on a journey to become the greatest conductor and ensembler.
But before that, you will need to learn the basics of conducting in this world.
During a performance, you are expected to do 3 things: trace, shake, and do nothing.
The most important one is trace: trace the flashing grey notes as they appear.
A good trace will increase your score, while a bad trace will decrease your score.
Shake means you move your baton as quickly as possible.
The more the movements, the more score awarded.
As for doing nothing... well, when you are not prompted to trace or shake, don't do anything.
Try moving at your own risk. Watch out for your score.
If you do well, the number of combos will increase, which gives you bonus scores.
You can change the volume as well by pressing "A" or "Z" while playing, although volume does not affect your score.
One last thing, notice the trail of shapes that follow your baton?
It is also an indication on how well you are doing in the level.
Consecutive incorrect moves will result in decreasing the number of shapes that follow your baton.
When the number of stars reaches zero, you will have to try the level again.
Alright, this is all you need to know about conducting in the world of Ensembler. Click on Forest Home, and have fun!
